intro: Phyllanthus pullenii, commonly known as the African date palm, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in compact clusters, which are followed by fleshy, orange-red fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
